results.title: Cocoon (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Richard Zanuck, David Brown, Lili Zanuck and Ron Howard
results.brief_description: Ron Howard’s enchanting sci-fi fantasy about a group of resident senior citizens in a Florida rest home who discover a fountain of youth from another planet is close to being the ultimate in feelgood movies. Their lives turned upside down when they meet some bizarre and not-so-human beings who are visitors from a distant galaxy. They have come to Earth on a rescue mission to retrieve a secret which has lain hidden on the ocean floor for thousands of years. They share a wondrous adventure and learn more about love and friendship than they ever imagined. Cast includes Don Ameche, Wilford Brimley, Hume Cronyn, Brian Dennehy, Jack Gifford, Steve Guttenberg, Maureen Stapleton, Jessica Tandy, Gwen Verdon, Herta Ware and Tahnee Welch.

results.title: Cocoa harvest
results.brief_description: The film shows the method of harvesting cocoa in the Gold Coast region of West Africa, including scenes of village life, sacks of beans on their way to the depot for grading and weighing, and finally transport by train and truck to the coast to be loaded on to ocean going steamers for export.

results.title: Cocktail (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Touchstone, Silver Screen Pictures, Interscope, Ted Field, Robert W. Court and Roger Donaldson
results.brief_description: When a young, confident and ambitious bartender moves to Jamaica he meets an artist and their romance brings a new perspective to his self-centered life. Stars Tom Cruise and Bryan Brown.

results.title: Cockpit drill
results.brief_description: Racing driver David Mackay discusses good driving drill: comfortable position, rear vision, and exact knowledge of “controls” (lights, wipers, choke, etc). Observe the road laws, always allowing for changing weather and traffic conditions. Exercise care when parking - turn off ignition, brake securely, and lock the car.

results.title: Cockleshell Bay
results.brief_description: A series of short animated stories about Robin and Rosie Cockle who move to Cockleshell Bay with their parents to set up a guest house. Whilst there they befriend old Mr Ship and Gran Routie who help them in their play. Rated: G

results.title: Cockfighter [DVD] (D)
results.creator_credit: Rio Pinto Productions, Artists Entertainment Complex Productions, New World Pictures, Roger Corman and Monte Hellman
results.brief_description: Set in Georgia, this drama of an obsessive man who has vowed not to speak until he has won the Cockfighter of the Year Award, was conceived as a low budget ($400,000) genre piece for the action circuit. It is transformed through a parable on the theme of the single-minded drive to find a kind of freedom through competition. Warren Oates puts in another fine performance as a man driven, obsessed with success, even on this depraved scale. As Frank drifts from fight to fight he becomes increasingly fanatical about triumphing over rival Jack Burke (Harry Dean Stanton). Frank displays an amorality that is particularly disturbing when it comes to women - upon losing his trailer, due to gambling, he blithely discards the young girl with whom he is attached, handing her over with the booty. The film is imbued with a particular ambivalence, refusing to take a stance on the humanitarian issues behind this brutal and underground sport. Reputedly director Monte Hellman (Two-Lane Blacktop) felt uncomfortable with the more sadistic aspects of the subject matter and producer Roger Corman inserted numerous graphic scenes of actual fights. Based on the novel by Charles Willeford, who also wrote the screenplay. Please be advised: scenes involving graphic violence against animals may disturb some viewers.

results.title: Cockatoos at Three Springs
results.brief_description: Filmed at Three Springs, a cockatoo haven in the middle of the Western Australian wheatbelt, this program looks at the characteristics and habits of various cockatoos. Also shows how the erosion of forests in the area to make way for wheat farming affects the lifestyle of the birds in terms of food and shelter.
